decks.notes: The main focus of this Sultai Control deck is to disrupt and maintain control over the game by using a variety of removal spells and counterspells to deal with threats from the opponent. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Koma, Cosmos Serpent and Polukranos, Unchained to apply pressure and close out the game. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion, providing additional value and synergies with the deck's numerous enters-the-battlefield effects. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's three-color requirements and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on maintaining control of the game through removal spells, counterspells, and powerful card advantage engines. By ramping up mana with cards like Cultivate and Wolfwillow Haven, the deck can cast big, game-winning spells like Emergent Ultimatum and Kiora Bests the Sea God. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value by flickering permanents with enter-the-battlefield abilities. The deck seeks to outvalue and outlast opponents by controlling the board and overwhelming them with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing counter spells and efficient removal to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes powerful finishers like Goldspan Dragon and Shark Typhoon to quickly close out the game. The mix of creatures and instant spells allows for flexibility in responding to threats, while the mana base ensures consistent access to both red and blue mana sources. Overall, the deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and maintain dominance through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disrupt their plans with removal spells and hand disruption. By utilizing cards like Claim the Firstborn and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, the deck aims to take control of the game early and maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Tymaret Calls the Dead and Woe Strider for card advantage and sacrifice synergies. The combination of aggressive creatures, disruption, and card advantage makes this deck a powerful and versatile option in the Aggro archetype.

The key strategy of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures while also utilizing powerful support cards like The Great Henge and Trail of Crumbs for card advantage and ramp. The deck focuses on generating value through creatures like Feasting Troll King and Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider, while also having flexibility with cards like Gemrazer for removal and Scavenging Ooze for graveyard hate. With a solid mix of threats and support, this Mono Green Aggro deck aims to quickly build a dominant board presence and outpace the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a strong board presence with aggressive creatures such as Brushfire Elemental and Lovestruck Beast. The use of powerful cards like Embercleave and The Great Henge help to push through damage and maintain card advantage. The inclusion of Goldspan Dragon provides a strong finisher and additional ramp. The pathway lands and Fabled Passage allow for consistent mana fixing. Showdown of the Skalds provides card draw and further boosts the aggro strategy. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early pressure and efficient threats.

This Naya Aggro deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Lovestruck Beast and Brushfire Elemental, backed up by powerful spells such as Showdown of the Skalds and Embercleave. The deck also includes versatile cards like Bonecrusher Giant and Scavenging Ooze to deal with threats and gain an advantage. The Great Henge provides additional value and card draw, while Shatterskull Smashing offers removal and reach. The mana base is optimized for consistency with various pathways and Fabled Passage. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and close out the game.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with cards that allow for fast and efficient creature removal while also disrupting the opponent's strategy. By utilizing powerful creatures like Valki, God of Lies and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, along with sacrifice outlets like Woe Strider and Village Rites, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain control throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Bonecrusher Giant and Bloodchief's Thirst provide additional removal options, while the combination of Tymaret Calls the Dead and Liliana, Waker of the Dead offer graveyard recursion for added value.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly building an aggressive board presence and maintaining pressure on the opponent. By playing efficient creatures like Robber of the Rich and Bonecrusher Giant, and using combat tricks like Embercleave and Showdown of the Skalds, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and close out the game before they can stabilize. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency, allowing for a smooth curve of threats from the early game to the late game.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through mill and removal spells while also generating card advantage with rogue creatures. By utilizing cheap and efficient creatures like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Merfolk Windrobber, combined with powerful mill effects like Ruin Crab and Soaring Thought-Thief, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by milling their cards while generating value for itself. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing the deck to recur its smaller creatures from the graveyard.

The deck focuses on maintaining control over the game by countering opponent's spells and removing threats with removal spells. It aims to generate card advantage with draw spells and outvalue the opponent with powerful late-game threats like Shark Typhoon and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. Yorion, Sky Nomad is used as a companion to provide additional value by blinking permanents for extra card advantage. The deck also includes a mix of disruptive spells like Jwari Disruption and Extinction Event to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to establish early board presence with efficient creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Kazandu Mammoth, while also utilizing cards like Lovestruck Beast and Bonecrusher Giant to control the board. The deck aims to pressure the opponent quickly and efficiently with aggressive creatures, while also utilizing powerful finishers like Questing Beast, Goldspan Dragon, Embercleave, and The Great Henge to end the game swiftly. The inclusion of removal spells like Fire Prophecy and Embereth Shieldbreaker allows the deck to deal with opposing threats and maintain its aggression.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through countering opponent's spells, removing threats with board wipes, and generating card advantage through card draw. It includes a mix of instant-speed interaction, powerful dragons like Goldspan Dragon, and versatile threats like Shark Typhoon. The mana base is designed to support both blue and red spells, with a mix of snow lands for synergy with Frost Bite and Faceless Haven. The goal is to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents by efficiently answering their threats while deploying powerful threats of your own.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence and apply pressure on the opponent through aggressive creature plays. The deck uses efficient green creatures like Feasting Troll King and Lovestruck Beast, supported by ramp spells like Gilded Goose and Tangled Florahedron. The inclusion of cards like Witch's Oven and Trail of Crumbs provide some utility and card advantage. Additionally, powerful cards like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and The Great Henge can help further solidify the deck's advantage and push for a quick victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive Rakdos creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It aims to control the board with removal spells and disruption while also generating value through sacrificing creatures and recurring them from the graveyard. With a mix of powerful threats like Goldspan Dragon and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, along with efficient removal spells and card draw engines like Village Rites and Tymaret Calls the Dead, this deck can push through damage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the inclusion of Egon, God of Death provides a versatile threat and graveyard hate.

The deck focuses on a aggressive playstyle with a combination of sacrificing, stealing, and controlling opponent's creatures. It utilizes cards like Claim the Firstborn and Village Rites to take advantage of sacrificing creatures, while also utilizing cards like The Akroan War and Tymaret Calls the Dead to control the board. With powerful creatures like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Goldspan Dragon, the deck aims to deal quick and consistent damage to the opponent. The inclusion of snow lands and snow spells like Frost Bite adds additional versatility and control to the deck.
